ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The seminar speakers were phenomenal. Great overview of different aspects and perspectives to global health and multilateralism.

- understanding the breadth of topics to be considered around pandemics 
- ability to approach complex systematically
thinking in a global  health systems perspective

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
speakers brought in were very high quality, high impact, and actively involved in the global COVID response
course covered diverse facets of COVID, giving students a great overview of where policy affects COVID, and vice versa
Strengths: small class size and direct interaction with professors and speakers.
Really enjoyed the mentorship groups, but would like more opportunities to explore some topics deeper

The strengths are the expertise each professor brings to the course and their connections to a wide range of guest speakers who bring really rich perspectives

It could be improved by being held more than once a week

LOVED the speakers that came to each lecture!! Sometimes they would go over time which made it hard to cover all the content we wanted to, but getting to hear from the foremost experts in the field was absolutely amazing. Also loved the hypothetical scenario exercises we engaged in.

- the Format with the guest speakers was great since it allowed insights from experts on different topics
- having three instructors with different backgrounds was very unique and really allowed to cover a broad range of topics
- improvements could be made regarding course management. There was some confusion around deadlines and expectations for assignments. A more coherent use of canvas could be beneficial in the future

We have really great speakers and not too many assignments, but the final was absurdly long. You are also required to attend every lecture with your camera on, which is honestly exhausting after a bunch of other Zoom classes.
learning from different professors was a strength because they all had different expertise. it could be improved by having more structure and clearer guidelines for assignments and discussion groups

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was very engage in particular due to class size and interactive format
I think the remote format really worked for this course. It would have been nice to have more discussions, we did it a few times and it really helped expand our learning.
clearer communication between professors and students about expectations and how we are doing in the course

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes!
Yes
Yes!! If you are at all interested in public health policy, take this course.
I would definitely recommend the class to other students. Its interdisciplinary set up made it very unique
yes but it might be less relevant after covid ends

comments: live virtual mentorship group meetings
